src.database module¶

src.database.add_experiment(username: str, data: list[list], population_size: int, simulation_seed: int, generation_count: int, strategy: float, aep: float, elite_count: int, alien_count: int, weights: list[int], connection_path: str = 'db/simulation_data.db') → None[source]¶

Adds the given csv data to the given connection

Parameters:

  • username (str) – The user adding the experiment data

  • data (list[list]) – The data to enter in the form list[list[generation: int, final_drive: float, roll_radius: float, gear_3: float, gear_4: float, gear_5: float, consumption: float, elasticity_3: float, elasticity_4: float, elasticity_5: float]]

  • connection_path (str) – The path to the database

src.database.add_user(username: str, password: str, role: str = 'data_analyst', connection_path: str = 'db/users.db') → None[source]¶

Adds a user to the user database

Parameters:

  • username (str) – The first Name of the User

  • role (str) – The users role

  • password (str) – The users password

  • connection_path (str) – path to the database

Returns:

bool: returns True if user has been added successfully, False otherwise

src.database.change_password(username: str, new_password: str, connection_path: str = 'db/users.db') → bool[source]¶

Changes a users password in the user database

Parameters:

  • username (str) – The name of the User

  • new_password (str) – The users new_password

  • connection_path (str) – path to the database

Returns:

returns True if the password has been changed successfully, False otherwise

Rytpe:

bool

src.database.change_role(username: str, role: str, connection_path: str = 'db/users.db')[source]¶

Changes a users name in the user database

Parameters:

  • username (str) – The name of the User to change the role of

  • role (str) – The users new role (simulator | data_analyst | administrator)

  • connection_path (str) – path to the database

Returns:

returns True if the role has been changed successfully, False otherwise

Rytpe:

bool

src.database.change_username(old_username: str, new_username: str, users_connection_path: str = 'db/users.db', simulation_data_connection_path: str = 'db/simulation_data.db')[source]¶

Changes a users name in the user database

Parameters:

  • old_username (str) – The name of the User to change

  • new_username (str) – The users new username

  • users_connection_path (str) – path to the users database

  • simulation_data_connection_path (str) – path to the simulation data database

Returns:

returns True if the username has been changed successfully, False otherwise

Rytpe:

bool

src.database.check_password(username: str, password: str, connection_path: str = 'db/users.db') → bool[source]¶

Checks if an entered password is correct

Parameters:

  • username (str) – The name of the user

  • password (str) – The entered password

  • connection_path (str) – path to the database

Returns:

returns True if the password is correct, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

src.database.delete_user(username: str, connection_path: str = 'db/users.db') → bool[source]¶

Deletes the given user.

Parameters:

  • username (str) – The name of the user

  • connection_path (str) – path to the database

Returns:

Returns true if deletion successful

Retype:

bool

src.database.export_experiment_data(columns: list[str] = [], constraints: list[str] = [], connection_path: str = 'db/simulation_data.db') → str[source]¶

Exports the data from the database to csv

Parameters:

file_path – The filepath of the resulting csv file

:type file_path

Parameters:

  • columns (list[str]) – The columns to be exported

  • constraints (list[str]) – The constraints to be applied. Contrainsts are in the form of “lhs op rhs” where lhs and rhs are either column names or numbers and op is one of the following operators: “<”,”>”,”<=”,”>=”,”=”, “<>”

  • connection_path (str) – The path to the database

Returns:

The path to the resulting csv file

Return type:

str

src.database.get_experiment(experiment_id: int, connection_path: str = 'db/simulation_data.db')[source]¶

Returns who ran which experiment

Parameters:

  • experiment_id (int) – The experiment_id

  • connection_path (str) – The path to the database

:returns The inputs used to run the experiment as well as username of the one who ran the experiment :type dict

Gets a list of all logs.

connection_path (str) – path to the database
